channel.title: Assignments on Foldable Robotics
channel.description: Recent content in Assignments on Foldable Robotics

item.title: Biomechanics Background and Initial Specifications
item.description:
Biomechanics Background and Initial Specifications

Assignment Overview

The goal of this part is to encourage you to get “bio-inspired”, to get you thinking about the scale of your robot, and to think about how to replicate the efficiencies of biological systems. You may refer to the developing specifications page for more information

Please Read this whole assignment first.

Suggestions

  • It will be useful to start using a program like Mendeley to collect and organize references.
  • Be creative in your search terms. Use ( Citation: Dickinson, Farley & al., 2000 Dickinson, M., Farley, C., Full, R., Koehl, M., Kram, R. & Lehman, S. (2000). How animals move: an integrative view.. Science (New York, N.Y.), 288(5463). 100â€“6. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.288.5463.100 ) to find good starting points for references and keywords.
  • Start writing down search keywords from class.

External Resources

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kleiber%27s_law

Rubric

Description Points
Bio Inspiration 20
Other bio-inspired robots 20
Table 40
Other Assumptions 10
Figures 20
Engineering Representation 20
Discussion 40
Bibliography 30
Total 200

Instructions

item.title: CATME I
item.description: CATME I Assignment Overview Please use the link provided in the email sent from CATME to complete an assessment of your teammates. Please remember that feedback to teammates will be released to them, so keep your criticism constructive Rubric Description Points Total 200

item.description: CATME II Assignment Overview Please use the link provided in the email sent from CATME to complete an assessment of your teammates. Please remember that feedback to teammates will be released to them, so keep your criticism constructive Rubric Description Points Total 200

item.title: Data Collection and Experimental Validation
item.description:
Data Collection and Experimental Validation

Assignment Overview

The purpose of this assignment is to collect data on your system and compare against the results estimated from simulation.

Rubric

Description Points

Figure(s) of Data 50
Image of Experimental 25
Video 25
Discussion 50

item.title: Design and Manufacturing Workflow
item.description:
Design and Manufacturing Workflow

Introduction

The purpose of this assignment is to plan for the manufacturing of the full system, test the output, and hopefully use it to produce a prototype.

Rubric

Description Points
1a 15
1b 15
2a 15
2b 15
3 30
4a 30
4b 30
4c 40
5 10
total 200

Resources

  • Solidworks Tutorial kinematics tutorial: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1En2zWrJg5EV_T9sTThubRUUclYcnW9jV&authuser=daukes%40asu.edu&usp=drive_fs
  • The macros for exporting a laminate to .dxf: https://github.com/popupcad/code_popupcad_solidworks_exporter

item.title: Design Optimization
item.description:
Design Optimization

Introduction

The purpose of this assignment is to optimize the dynamics of your system to maximize performance against your team’s selected research question and design goal.

Rubric

Description Points
1a 20
1b 10
1c 10
1d 20
1e 40
2a 15
2b 10
3 50
4 25
Total 200

Instructions

item.title: Develop a Research Question
item.description:
Develop a Research Question

Introduction

Generate a research question worthy of your time.

Rubric

Description Points
Question 30
Tractability Discussion 20
Novelty Discussion 30
Interesting Discussion 40
Open-endedness Discussion 20
Modularity Discussion 20
Team Fit Discussion 20
Topic Fit Discussion 20
Total 200

Resources

  • The associated module on developing a research question
  • Mendeley Desktop, a useful citation manager

Instructions

item.title: Dynamics II Plan
item.description: Dynamics II Plan Introduction The purpose of this assignment is to decide as a team how you will split up the various Parameter ID tasks individually Rubric Description Points Total 0 Instructions Identify and discuss the materials you plan to use in fabrication. Decide who will be obtaining those materials and distributing them. Identify and Discuss the various parameters you plan to model in your simulation, including

item.title: Dynamics II Prep (Parameter ID)
item.description:
Dynamics II Prep

Introduction

The purpose of this assignment is to get your team to model the various aspects of your model including

  • The full system
  • Actuator Parameters
  • Energy Storage Devices
  • System / Link Stiffness
  • Damping and Friction

Rubric

Description Points
Total 100

Instructions

item.title: Incoming Survey
item.description:
Incoming Survey

Assignment Overview

The goal of this assignment is to learn about you, your background, and your interests and abilities.

Rubric

Description Points
Total 50

item.description:
Install Solidworks

Assignment Overview

The goal here is to ensure you have Solidworks installed correctly.

Rubric

Solidworks Installed 20

Optional External Resources

GNU Image Manipulation Program (Image Editor)

item.title: Intro to Shapely
item.description:
Shapely & Manufacturing

Overview

The purpose of this exercise is to get used to working with shapely polygons and to use it to compute some manufacturing geometry. It is your job to determine how to compute the cut files using Python, shapely, and the foldable_robotics package

Rubric

Description Points
Steps 60
Discussion 40
Total 100

Resources

  • https://github.com/idealabasu/code_foldable_robotics
  • The Shapely User Manual

Instructions

item.title: Kinematics Via Prototyping & CAD
item.description:
Kinematics Via Prototyping & CAD

Introduction

The goal of this assignment is to 1) propose a mechanism that your team can study as part of a larger laminate system, and 2) to get you comfortable sketching the kinematics of foldable systems in CAD, establishing constraints, and counting degrees of freedom.

Rubric

Description Points
Picture of prototype 25
Evaluation of 2D/3D 5
Drawing of Kinematics 25
DOF 5
Input/Output 10
Range of Motion 10
discussion 20
Total 100

Prerequisites

  1. Solidworks should be installed. It may be downloaded from https://myapps.asu.edu.

Instructions

item.title: Make a Pop-up Book
item.description:
Make a Pop-up Book

Assignment Overview

The goal of this assignment is to search externally for origami-inspired mechanisms you could use for your project. Additionally, this assignment is meant to make you think critically about how the manufacturing of foldable robots is intertwined with cutting and joining processes, and to appreciate the automation

Rubric

Description Points
Report 80
Figure(s) 40
Pictures 40
Videos 20
References 20
Total 200

External Resources

  • Video Series by D. Birmingham:
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aGJZbNh9Phs
  • Itai Cohen Explains The Physics of Origami
    http://www.cornell.edu/video/itai-cohen-explains-origami-physics
  • KMMODL Linkage Collection http://kmoddl.library.cornell.edu/index.php

Instructions

Assignment Overview

The purpose of this assignment is to create a project website as a living document that will document all your work for the class.

Rubric

Total 100

  • https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet

Instructions

item.title: Presentation Feedback I
item.description:
Presentation Feedback I

Assignment Overview

Each of you is responsible for compiling at least three questions and submitting them to teams via a google form. Comments are helpful, but questions which require teams to address holes in their design are most useful. Be constructive and thoughtful.

Rubric

Description Points
Total 0

Instructions

item.title: Project Pitches
item.description:
Project Pitches

Overview

The goal of this assignment is to permit those interested in pitching their ideas to attract a group of people interested in joining them. This pitch will be used to inspire and promote discussion amongst students before teams are formed.

This is your opportunity to shape your semester and to accomplish a personal research goal through class. If, after group discussion, you wish to create other pitches, you may upload them independently to the Google Drive Folder listed below.

Rubric

Description Points
Total 0

Instructions

item.title: Project Selection Survey
item.description:
Project Selection Survey

Introduction

Rubric

Description Points
Total 20

Instructions

item.title: Python for Loops. Arrays. and Plotting
item.description:
Python for loops, Arrays, and Plotting

Introduction

The purpose of this assignment is to get to know Python and Juptyer Notebook.

Resources

Python

  • Basic Intro
  • Control Flow: For, if, etc
  • For loops
  • List Comprehensions in Python

Arrays

  • NumPy for Matlab users
  • Quickstart Tutorial
  • Absolute Beginners Tutorial

Plotting with Matplotlib

  • Matplotlib Tutorials, specifically the pyplot tutorial
  • General Examples and pyplot examples
  • titles
  • equal axis
  • savefig() examples

Rubric

Description Points
Looping 30
Arrays 30
Plotting 40
Total 100

Instructions

item.title: Python Functions
item.description:
Python Functions

Introduction

The purpose of this assignment is to get you comfortable understanding the basics of python functions and how to use them with arguments and keyword arguments

Rubric

Description Points
Report 30
Code 70
Total 100

Resources

  • *args and **kwargs in python explained
  • NumPy for Matlab users

Instructions

item.title: Sarrus Kinematics
item.description:
Spherical Kinematics

Assignment Overview

The purpose of this assignment is to get you comfortable using the numerical computational capabilities of Python to start estimating the performance of your design.

item.title: System Dynamics I
item.description:
System Dynamics I

Assignment Overview

This assignment is intended to get you familiar with the dynamics of your system. We will start with the triple pendulum example and turn it into a leg.

Rubric

Description Points
Draft 30
Step 1 30
Step 2 30
Step 3 30
Step 4 30
Step 5 30
Step 6 20
Total 200

Resources

  • dynamics modules

Instructions

item.title: System Dynamics II
item.description:
System Dynamics II

Assignment Overview

The point of this assignment is to re-consolidate everything you have learned about your system back into your dynamic model. It should now include:

  • at least one “compliant” element
  • all unknown parameters determined and included.
    • joint or system-level damping determined
  • An actuator model or stored energy source.
  • Ground constraints eliminated (if applicable)
  • Closed-loop constraints (if applicable)
  • valid initial condition

Rubric

Description Points
Procedure 50
Discussion 60
Code 50
Figures/Videos 40
Total 200

Instructions
